subject: Gardening
title: Victory Gardens: Growing as Patriotism
description: A micro-lesson that makes Victory Gardens: Growing as Patriotism usable.

hook.text: During WWII, 20 million American victory gardens produced 40% of the nation's vegetables. Gardening was a war effort.

buildup.text: The government promoted victory gardens to free up commercial food for troops. 'Food Fights for Freedom' was the slogan.

discovery.text: Eleanor Roosevelt planted a victory garden on the White House lawnâ€”shocking commercial farmers who feared lost sales.

twist.text: After the war, the food industry lobbied to end victory gardens. Self-sufficient citizens buy less processed food.

climax.text: Victory gardens showed that citizens can produce massive food volumes. Industry worked hard to make them forget.

punchline.text: Industry killed victory gardens. Self-sufficiency is bad for sales.

quiz.question: Why did the food industry lobby to end victory gardens after WWII?
options: Home-grown vegetables were found to be less nutritious than commercial ones
Self-sufficient gardeners buy less processed food, reducing industry sales
Pesticides used in victory gardens contaminated municipal water supplies
